text: The Union populaire française (UPF, English: "French Popular Union") was a parliamentary group in the French Parliament formed in 1939 by breakaway members of the French Communist Party who opposed the Molotov-Ribbentrop Pact. Prominent members included Émile Fouchard, Eugène Jardon and René Nicod. Category:Political parties of the French Third Republic Category:Defunct political parties in France Category:Political parties established in 1939 Category:1939 establishments in France Category:Political parties with year of disestablishment missing
title: Union populaire française
